text: The library is open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays and 10 AM to 6 PM on weekends.
You can access the e-library by logging into the student portal with your college credentials.
The next semester starts on January 15th.
The grading policy is based on a 10-point CGPA system with grades ranging from O (Outstanding) to F (Fail).
You can apply for re-evaluation through the student portal under the 'Examinations' section.
The hostel fees are ₹50,000 per semester, including accommodation and meals.
You need to log in to the student portal, fill in your course preferences, and pay the semester fees.
The academic calendar is available on the college website under the 'Academics' section.
You can join a student club by attending their orientation sessions or contacting the club coordinator.
Yes, scholarships are available based on merit and financial need. Check the 'Scholarships' section on the college website.
Placement drives are scheduled from February to April. Keep an eye on the placement portal for updates.
The attendance requirement is 75% for each subject to be eligible for exams.
You can contact your professors via email or during their office hours, listed on the department notice board.
The dining hall is open from 7 AM to 9 PM, with specific slots for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Tuition fees can be paid online through the student portal or at the accounts office.
Yes, there is a fully-equipped gym on campus open from 6 AM to 9 PM.
You can get a student ID card from the administration office after completing your registration.
You can request a transcript through the student portal under the 'Academics' section.
Use your student credentials to log in to the campus Wi-Fi network.
The cultural fest is scheduled for March 20th to 22nd.
Yes, you can apply for part-time jobs on campus through the career services office.
Submit a leave application form through the student portal or directly to your department office.
Submit your internship details to the placement office for approval.
Past exam papers are available in the library or the student portal under 'Resources'.
You can update your contact details through the student portal under the 'Profile' section.
Fill out the hostel application form available on the student portal.
You need a CGPA of 9.0 or above and no disciplinary records to qualify for the Dean's List.
You can check your attendance on the student portal under the 'Attendance' section.
The refund policy is detailed in the student handbook under the 'Fees' section.
The midterm exams are scheduled for October 10th to 15th.
Contact your department head or a faculty member working in your area of interest.
Yes, there is a mentoring program. You can sign up through the student portal.
Seminar rooms can be booked through the facilities management office.
The campus has facilities for cricket, football, basketball, badminton, and tennis.
The convocation ceremony is scheduled for November 25th.
Workshop registrations are available on the events section of the student portal.
You can apply for a bonafide certificate through the administration office or student portal.
Information about electives is available in the course catalog on the student portal.
Apply through the international relations office with your academic and extracurricular records.
Yes, coding contests are organized every semester by the computer science department.
Visit the campus health center for any medical assistance.
The syllabus is available on the student portal under 'Academics'.
Assignments can be submitted through the LMS or directly to your professor.
Submit a course withdrawal form through the student portal.
Yes, the college offers language courses in French, Spanish, and German.
Report lost items to the security office or the lost and found section.
Consult with your academic advisor and submit a major change form.
Exam results will be declared two weeks after the exams.
Visit the administration office to request a reissue of your ID card.
Register for sports events through the sports department or student portal.
The release date of the 6th semester exam is January 26th.
The result of the 5th semester will be declared on February 15th.
